A content page

The UI-kit is not prescriptive with respect to boilerplating but instead provides modular components to permit easy site building.

For example, this page replaces the site header with larger global one and the large section hero with a smaller one.

How about some sample content?

Those pesky trees… While the TV tower upgrades are expected to improve the TV reception, some households will still have trouble (even if they have proper antenna equipment and installation) because TV signals get obstructed by the hilly countryside, trees or buildings. If you still can’t get reliable TV reception, you can join the other 200,000 households across Australia and take advantage of the Viewer Access Satellite Television (VAST) service.

  • Catalyst—Australian Arts and Culture Fund supports more than 70 innovative projects

    Date published: 2 May 2016

    $10 million for more than 70 projects through the Catalyst Australian Arts and Culture Fund.

  • New eSafety Women website launched

    Date published: 2 May 2016

    A new website which empowers women to take control online and protect themselves from technology-facilitated abuse
